alert.note: Alert for Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:10PM EST until December 19 at 5:03AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Souhegan River At Milford affecting Hillsborough County. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Belknap and Merrimack Counties. Ammonoosuc River At Bethlehem affecting Grafton County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ammonoosuc River at Bethlehem. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding occurs along portions Route 116 and Whitefield Road. Portions of Feather Lane, Wing Road, Hazen Road, and Prospect Street are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EST Monday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
